meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adjective 'shirty': more irritable or bad-tempered.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he became even shirtier when his dinner was late.
meanings.sent2: She gets shirtier when she's hungry and tired.
meanings.sent3: The shirtier he got, the more his coworkers avoided him.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as shirtier than a stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The shirtier cat hissed at anyone who came near.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of the noun 'shirt': a garment for the upper body typically having a collar, sleeves, and a front opening.
meanings.sent1: She bought a shirtier with colorful stripes for the party.
meanings.sent2: He ironed his favorite shirtier for the job interview.
meanings.sent3: The shirtier she wore to the beach was too big and kept slipping off.
meanings.sent4: Her closet was filled with shirtiers of all colors and styles.
meanings.sent5: The shirtier he wore had a unique pattern that caught everyone's eye.
